basic.floral_language:
Haworthia limifolia
Floriography: classical, grand, noble
Has a peculiar triangular leaf shape with a sharp tip, closely arranged like a windmill blade, leaf tissues rigid, marked by raised stripes, evergreen normally, but with a great daily temperature range and abundant sunlight, leaves turn red, 
Likes gentle sunshine, tolerates to half shade, avoid direct strong sunlight, does not have an apparent dormant period. Flowers when conditions are right. Flowers are light green.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, light green flowers
basic.color: Leaf color dark green, with a great diurnal temperature range and adequate sunlight slightly turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like moderate light, resistant to half shade, no apparent dormancy , shade properly under summer strong light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
